entry.note: Title of a stage in diagnostic viewer

message.entry: Observer
Observer's Stateflow support feature is not available.
Cannot configure Observer Port ''{0}'' because its parent model ''{1}'' is open in standalone mode.
Observer model ''{0}'' referenced by Observer Reference block ''{1}'' was not found.
The 'ObserverModelName' parameter of the Observer Reference block ''{0}'' is empty. Specify a valid model name.
Cannot configure Observer ''{0}'' because its design model ''{1}'' is currently being compiled or simulated.
Cannot configure Observer ''{0}'' because its Observer model ''{1}'' is currently being compiled or simulated.
Cannot configure Observer ''{0}'' because its Observer model ''{1}'' is currently locked.
Cannot configure Observer Port ''{0}'' because it is located inside a library.
Observer Model ''{0}'' referenced by model ''{1}'' is already in simulation.
Click to configure/reconfigure Observer Port block: {0}
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is not observing a valid entity.
Unable to place Observer Port block at destination''{0}''. Observer port blocks allowed only inside Model blocks or Subsystems.
Unable to place Observer Port block because destination is not a valid handle.
Unable to place Observer Reference block because System model is not a valid model handle.
Unable to configure Observer Port because its not a valid block handle.
Invalid port index. Port index must be a positive integer.
Cannot configure Observer Port ''{0}'' because it is not a valid Observer Port Block.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is configured to observe signal ''{1}'', but this signal cannot be observed. This may be due to optimizations during model compile.
Specified Stateflow object not found in Stateflow Chart ''{0}'' or invalid Stateflow state.
Specified Stateflow object not found in Stateflow chart ''{0}'' or invalid Stateflow local data.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' was configured to observe chart local data or self activity of a state, but that is not available anymore. Please delete or reconfigure the Observer Port block.
Faults are not allowed in Observer models. Please close Observer model ''{0}'' and remove its associated fault information file.
''{0}'' referenced by ''{1}''
Invalid Observer Reference block ''{0}''. Observer model referenced by this block is currently open for another Observer Reference. Close the Observer model and retry.
Invalid Observer model ''{0}''. Observer model is currently open in the context of another Observer Reference.

Unable to set Observer model ''{0}''. Observer model is referenced by Observer Reference block ''{1}'', which is currently open in the context of the Observer Reference block. Close the Observer model and retry.
Invalid Observer Reference block ''{0}''.
Invalid Observer Reference block handle.
<Enter Model Name>
Invalid entity type ''{0}''. Valid types are Signal, SFStateActivity, SFData, and FMUInternalVariable.
Invalid Stateflow chart ''{0}''.
Invalid port index: {0}. A valid port index cannot exceed the number of outports of the block.
''{0}''is not a valid Activity type. Currently only self activity is supported
Unable to observe entity in Observer model ''{0}''. Open model in standalone mode.
Unable to observe entity because it is in Observer model ''{0}'' that is currently open in context of another Observer Reference.
Unable to observe entity because model ''{0}'' appears more than once in the model reference hierarchy.
''{0}'' (unloaded) referenced by ''{1}''
The specified Observer Port with SID ''{0}'' no longer exists.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is configured to observe signal ''{1}'', but this signal cannot be observed because it is {2}. This may be due to optimizations during model compile.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is configured to observe signal ''{1}'', but this signal cannot be observed because its sub-signal ''{2}'' is {3}. This may be due to optimizations during model compile.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is set to observe invalid signal ''{1}''. Currently only scalar signals and non-virtual buses are supported.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is set to observe an undefined bus signal ''{1}'' of block ''{2}''. Create the bus object in the base workspace or Simulink Data Dictionary.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is set to observe invalid signal ''{1}'', because the data type of the observed signal ''{2}'' is not supported.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is set to observe invalid bus signal ''{1}'', because its data type ''{2}'' contains a sub-signal ''{3}'' of unsupported data type ''{4}''.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is set to observe invalid signal ''{1}'', because the data type of the observed signal ''{2}'' is an alias of unsupported data type ''{3}''.

Observer Port block ''{0}'' is set to observe invalid bus signal ''{1}'', because its data type ''{2}'' contains a sub-signal ''{3}'' of data type ''{4}'', which is an alias of unsupported data type ''{5}''.
Observer Port block ''{0}'' is set to observe invalid signal ''{1}''. Sample time must be one of: discrete, continuous, constant, variable
Observer related blocks cannot be used inside For Each subsystems.

The diagnostic ''Mux blocks used to create bus signals'' in Connectivity pane of the Diagnostics page in the Configuration Parameters Dialog is set to either ''warning'' or ''none''. To use Observer or Observer Port it has to be set to ''error''. Please change the setting and try the operation again.
Code generation is not supported for model ''{0}'' as it is either being used as an Observer model or contains Observer Reference blocks. The Observer Reference blocks will be ignored.
The Observer Reference block ''{0}'' has been ignored because its parent model ''{1}'' is being compiled as a referenced model.
Observer Port ''{0}'' is configured to observe inside Model block ''{1}'', but the observed entity does not reside in its referencing model.
The Observer mapping parameters are read-only.

Data Store Read/Write block ''{0}'' does not have a corresponding Data Store Memory block inside Observer ''{1}''. Local Data Store connections cannot cross Observer boundaries, and access to global DSM inside Observers is not allowed.
Cannot access block state of ''{0}'' across the boundary of Observer ''{1}''. Block state access cannot cross Observer boundaries.
Cannot access block parameter of ''{0}'' across the boundary of Observer ''{1}''. Block parameter access cannot cross Observer boundaries.
Dashboard block ''{0}'' is accessing its bound element across the boundary of Observer ''{1}''. Dashboard block binding cannot cross Observer boundaries.
Goto block ''{0}'' is located inside an Observer, but one of its corresponding From blocks ''{1}'' is outside. Goto/From connections cannot cross Observer boundaries.
Goto block ''{0}'' is located inside an Observer, but its corresponding Goto Tag Visibility block ''{1}'' is outside. Goto/From connections cannot cross Observer boundaries.
From block ''{0}'' is located inside an Observer, but its corresponding Goto block ''{1}'' is outside. Goto/From connections cannot cross Observer boundaries.

Cannot convert Subsystem ''{0}'' to Observer because there are Function Callers to the Simulink Function ''{1}'' inside the Subsystem, but the definition is outside. Simulink Function calls cannot cross Observer boundaries.

Cannot convert Subsystem ''{0}'' to Observer because there are Function Callers to the Simulink Function ''{1}'' outside the Subsystem, but the definition is inside. Simulink Function calls cannot cross Observer boundaries.
Cannot create Subsystem from Observer Reference ''{0}'': Observer Reference blocks must reside in the root level of a model.
The Observer Port block cannot be configured because the specified observed entity is invalid.
Do you wish to move the block ''{0}'' to Observer ''{1}''? All Signal Viewers and Test Harnesses associated with this block will be lost. This operation cannot be undone.
move ''{0}'' to Observer
The selected block cannot be sent to an Observer.
Cannot move ''{0}'' to Observer because it has output ports.
Cannot move ''{0}'' to Observer because it has connection ports.
Cannot move ''{0}'' to Observer because it has no input ports.
Cannot move ''{0}'' to Observer because it is already inside an Observer.
Cannot move ''{0}'' to Observer because it has unconnected input ports.
Cannot configure Observer Port ''{0}'' to observer Internal Variable's of FMU Block ''{1}'' because its not a valid FMU Block.
Cannot Observer Internal Variable's of FMU Block ''{0}'' because its not a valid FMU Block.

To observe, select the output signal or the state of any block that belongs to the component under observation.
This block references the specified model as an Observer model and contains the binding information for all Observer Ports in the referenced model.
''{0}'' is not a valid name for an observer model. The name of the observer model must be a valid MATLAB identifier.
Cannot use ''{0}'' as the observer model name because a model of the same name is currently open. Please enter a different name.
The observer name ''{0}'' shadows another name in the MATLAB workspace or path.

Model ''{0}'' is being compiled/simulated as a standalone model, though it is opened in the context of Observer Reference ''{1}''. To compile/simulate this model as an Observer, please use the command options on its design model ''{2}''.
Model ''{0}'' is being compiled/simulated as an Observer model for Model ''{1}''.

Observer port ''{0}'' is incorrectly configured. To observe conditional data, the aperiodic partition ''{1}'' must contain exactly one Observer Port.

Observer port ''{0}'' is incorrectly configured. To observe conditional data, this Observer Port must be inside an aperiodic partition. Click here to create a new aperiodic partition in observer model ''{1}''.
Aperiodic partition names in Observer models must be unique. Found duplicate partition name ''{0}'' in ''{1}''.
Mux and demux signals (''{0}'') cannot be observed in conditional subsystems if they contain more than one signal.
